sense.name: abnormal medical condition
sense.examples: It's a rare form of personality disorder. The child has been diagnosed with a mild learning disorder. She takes medication for a metabolic disorder.

sense.name: unorganized, messy, disarray
sense.commentary: DISORDER[+state][-organized][+messy] Note: implies either physical or abstract organizational mess
sense.examples: The house is in such disorder that I don't know where to start cleaning up. After the talented manager quit, his department fell into a state of disorder and confusion. The girl's clothes lay in disorder all over the bedroom floor.

sense.name: civic unrest, disturbing the peace
sense.commentary: DISORDER[+state][+unrest][+civic] Note: implies protest, unlawful conduct, violence
sense.examples: Widespread social disorder has resulted from the currency collapse. The police reported a disorder last night in front of Rosie's bar. Recurrent food shortages led to outbreaks of disorder in the city.
